body:
Hmm, I don't think anything changed around this in 7.0...

Here's the code that takes it from the database model and sets it on the ModelCodeGenerationOptions:

https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/blob/bf20e32fa8d0888f7d531a25c146284285d980a3/src/EFCore.Design/Scaffolding/Internal/ReverseEngineerScaffolder.cs#L93-L99
@ErikEJ Can you give a few more details on what the impact is here? For example, is this breaking anything for customers?

No, it just adds this line to the generated DbContext as mentioned above:

`modelBuilder.HasAnnotation("Scaffolding:ConnectionString", "Data Source=(local);Initial Catalog=GroupOnline.DigitalContracts.Database;Integrated Security=true");`

Feel free to close as it is more of a cosmetic issue
Ah, we don't remove it from the model. Yeah, we should do that.

issue.title: Scaffolding: Fix handling of ConnectionString annotation

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.
